# Pete the Pup

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Jump to: navigation, search

For the Don Marquis character, see [Pete the Pup (archy and
mehitabel)](/wiki/Pete_the_Pup_\(archy_and_mehitabel\) "Pete the Pup \(archy
and mehitabel\)").

Pete the Pup  
---  
[![Schools-out-our-
gang-1930.jpg](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/53/Schools-
out-our-gang-1930.jpg/220px-Schools-out-our-
gang-1930.jpg)](/wiki/File:Schools-out-our-gang-1930.jpg) Pete the Pup,
_center_ , with [Matthew "Stymie"
Beard](/wiki/Matthew_Beard_\(American_actor\) "Matthew Beard \(American
actor\)") and [Bobby "Wheezer" Hutchins](/wiki/Bobby_Hutchins "Bobby
Hutchins") in the _[Our Gang](/wiki/Our_Gang "Our Gang")_ comedy _[School's
Out](/wiki/School%27s_Out_\(1930_film\) "School's Out \(1930 film\)")_, 1930.  
First appearance | 1927  
Last appearance | 1938  
Portrayed by | Pal the Wonder Dog, Lucenay's Peter, and other dogs  
Information  
Nickname(s) | Petey  
Species | Dog  
Gender | Male  
  
**Pete the Pup** (original, 1924 – June 1930; second Pete, September 9, 1929 –
January 28, 1946) was a [character](/wiki/Fictional_character "Fictional
character") in [Hal Roach](/wiki/Hal_Roach "Hal Roach")'s _[Our
Gang](/wiki/Our_Gang "Our Gang")_ comedies (later known as _The Little
Rascals_) during the 1930s. Otherwise known as "Pete, the Dog With the Ring
Around His Eye", or simply "Petey", he was well known for having a circled eye
that was added on by [Hollywood](/wiki/Hollywood "Hollywood") make-up artist
[Max Factor](/wiki/Max_Factor,_Sr. "Max Factor, Sr.")[1] and credited as an
oddity in _[Ripley's Believe It or Not](/wiki/Ripley%27s_Believe_It_or_Not
"Ripley's Believe It or Not")_. The original Pete (sired by "Tudor's Black
Jack") was an [APBT](/wiki/American_Pit_Bull_Terrier "American Pit Bull
Terrier") named "Pal, the Wonder Dog", and had a natural ring almost
completely around his right eye; dye was used to finish it off.

## Contents

[hide]

  * 1 History
  * 2 Death
  * 3 External links
  * 4 References

## History[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Pete_the_Pup&action=edit&section=1 "Edit
section: History")]

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b3/Our_Gang_with_Director_Robert_McGowan.jpg/260px-
Our_Gang_with_Director_Robert_McGowan.jpg)](/wiki/File:Our_Gang_with_Director_Robert_McGowan.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:Our_Gang_with_Director_Robert_McGowan.jpg "Enlarge")

Pal the Wonder Dog as Pete, along with _Our Gang_ cast with Director Robert
McGowan.

When he was about six months old, Pal the Wonder Dog made a cameo appearance
in the [Harold Lloyd](/wiki/Harold_Lloyd "Harold Lloyd") film _[The
Freshman](/wiki/The_Freshman_\(1925_film\) "The Freshman \(1925 film\)")_ , in
1925.[2]

Pal first started out as "Tige" in the _[Buster Brown](/wiki/Buster_Brown
"Buster Brown")_ series in the 1920s. It was during this time that he acquired
the circled eye, and when he was recruited to appear in the _Our Gang_
comedies later that year, [Hal Roach](/wiki/Hal_Roach "Hal Roach") simply left
it on, creating one of the most recognized dogs in film history.

Trainer and owner Lt. Harry Lucenay used one of Pal's offspring as Pete in the
series after Pal was poisoned and died in 1930.[3] The dog, named Lucenay's
Peter, was bred by A. A. Keller. The second Pete looked very similar to the
first Pete but was a mirror image. The circle was on the right eye on the
first Pete while it was on the left eye on the second Pete. The second Pete
appeared as a puppy on _[Pups Is Pups](/wiki/Pups_Is_Pups "Pups Is Pups")_ and
was nearly full-grown on his second appearance, _[School's
Out](/wiki/School%27s_Out_\(1930_film\) "School's Out \(1930 film\)")_. The
second Pete's last _Our Gang_ appearance was _[The Pooch](/wiki/The_Pooch "The
Pooch")_ in 1932 when, in the plot, a [dog catcher](/wiki/Dog_catcher "Dog
catcher") attempts to kill Pete in a gas chamber but is unsuccessful. So
Lucenay's Peter was the best known. After Lucenay was fired from the _Our
Gang_ series in 1932, he retired Peter to [Atlantic City](/wiki/Atlantic_City
"Atlantic City"), where he was photographed with children at the [Steel
Pier](/wiki/Steel_Pier "Steel Pier"). Beginning with _[Hook and
Ladder](/wiki/Hook_and_Ladder_\(1932_film\) "Hook and Ladder \(1932 film\)")_
later in 1932, an unrelated dog played Pete and until 1938 a few unrelated
dogs would play the role, though in less prominent roles than in the early
1930s.

In the [1982 cartoon series](/wiki/The_Little_Rascals_\(animated_TV_series\)
"The Little Rascals \(animated TV series\)") produced by [Hanna-
Barbera](/wiki/Hanna-Barbera_Productions "Hanna-Barbera Productions"), he was
voiced by [Peter Cullen](/wiki/Peter_Cullen "Peter Cullen"). In the 1994
feature film remake of _[The Little Rascals](/wiki/The_Little_Rascals_\(film\)
"The Little Rascals \(film\)")_ , Pete is an American Bulldog, and in the 2014
movie _[The Little Rascals Save the Day](/wiki/The_Little_Rascals_Save_the_Day
"The Little Rascals Save the Day")_ , Pete is a mongrel dog.

A parody of Pete appeared breifly in the Bob Hope short [Watch the
Birdie](/w/index.php?title=Watch_the_Birdie_\(1935_film\)&action=edit&redlink=1
"Watch the Birdie \(1935 film\) \(page does not exist\)"), produced by
competitor, [Warner Bros.](/wiki/Warner_Bros. "Warner Bros.")

## Death[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Pete_the_Pup&action=edit&section=2 "Edit
section: Death")]

Roach used a number of unrelated dogs to portray Pete in _Our Gang_ until
1938.[3] Lucenay's Peter continued on and died of old age on January 28, 1946,
in [Los Angeles, California](/wiki/Los_Angeles,_California "Los Angeles,
California"), at age 16 years/4 months, two years after the _Our Gang_ series
ended. Pete is buried at [Los Angeles Pet Memorial
Park](/wiki/Los_Angeles_Pet_Memorial_Park "Los Angeles Pet Memorial Park") at
[Calabasas](/wiki/Calabasas "Calabasas"), [Los Angeles](/wiki/Los_Angeles "Los
Angeles") County, California, United States.
